intro: Navarretia millefolia, commonly known as the common navarretia, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in coastal and inland habitats. Navarretia millefolia is an important plant for pollinators and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
